snippet: The United States is conducting a diplomatic full-court press to try to block Edward J. Snowden from finding refuge in Latin America.
abstract: United States is conducting a diplomatic full-court press to try to block Edward J Snowden from finding refuge in Latin America; three left-leaning governments there that make defying Washington a hallmark of their foreign policies have publicly vowed to take him in; US is finding its leverage in region limited.

byline.original: By WILLIAM NEUMAN and RANDAL C. ARCHIBOLD
byline.contributor: William Neuman reported from Caracas, and Randal C. Archibold from Mexico City. Larry Rohter contributed reporting from Rio de Janeiro.

lead_paragraph: The United States is conducting a diplomatic full-court press to try to block Edward J. Snowden from finding refuge in Latin America.

headline.main: U.S. Is Pressing Latin Americans to Reject Snowden
headline.print_headline: U.S. Is Pressing Latin Americans To Reject Leaker
